p: The intestinal bacterial community in our three control samples resembles that found in 11 cod individuals from the inner Oslo fjord [ 16], as it is dominated by Vibrionales and Bacteroidales, followed by Clostridiales and Desulfovibrionales. The large proportion of Vibrionales (median: 55%) in our samples is close to what is observed by Star et al. (median: 50%) [ 16] and is also in agreement with findings in other marine carnivores [ 51]. Further, members of the most abundant orders have previously been reported in Atlantic cod [ 49, 52â€“ 55]. Although the comparison with the Oslo fjord samples is based on a small sample sizes, the similarity between these communities indicates that our laboratory setting did not alter the species composition drastically compared to those found in wild populations.
